alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 6:35PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN AND GUSTY WINDS POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY... A tropical system, known as Invest 94W, continues to be monitored by the Joint Typhoon Warning Center (JTWC) and your National Weather Service Forecast Office in Guam. This system is forecast to start to become better organized as we progress through Monday and Tuesday as it lifts slowly north. Another circulation, known as Invest 95W, is also expected to develop during this time well to the north of the Marianas. Both systems will allow a southerly to southwesterly monsoon flow to develop, helping bring deeper tropical moisture northward through the region. At this time, all numerical guidance indicates a strengthening and elongating monsoonal flow will persist for the middle to end of the week, perhaps longer. Model solutions also suggest that the tropical circulation will continue to gradually strengthen as it passes through, with heavy rainfall and gusty winds developing. The potential is fairly high for locally heavy rainfall of 4 to 8 inches to develop, with locally higher amounts possible. Gusty winds of 30 to 45 mph may also develop near any stronger shower or thunderstorm that develops.
